messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] crying
messages.msgSnippet: swaddling gentle bouncy seat holding the baby out so they could see holding baby along your arm, legs at elbow, head at hand One of mine like this. :-) Barb E
messages.messageBody:
swaddling
gentle bouncy seat
holding the baby out so they could see
holding baby along your arm, legs at elbow, head at hand One of mine like
this. :-)


Barb E
Read, every day, something that no one else is reading.
Think, every day, something that no one else is thinking.
Do, every day, something no one else would be silly enough to do.
It is bad for the mind to continually be part of unanimity.
~Christopher Morley





on 8/7/03 2:54 PM, SandraDodd@... at SandraDodd@... wrote:
"take some clothes off or put more clothes on"
>
> "more light, or less light"
>
> "walk in a stroller"
>
> "bath or water play"
>
> "sing"

messages.subject: crying
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/7/03 11:48:41 AM, Heatherette@comcast.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/03 11:48:41 AM, Heatherette@... writes:

<< There are days Crispin just cries all day long and I
have no idea why, look at his mouth, his butt, feel his tummy, take him
to the Chiropractor, let him lay in the middle of the floor and scream
and feel like a failure. >>

I used to have a great list when Kirby was little of fifty things to try when
babies are crying. I'll go and see if it's online somewhere, but I remember
some were "take some clothes off or put more clothes on"

"more light, or less light"

"walk in a stroller"

"bath or water play"

"sing"
